description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 3 iterations of function f(x) = 3x + 2.
comments: n, 3*n+2, 9*n+8 and 27*n+26 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: Select[Prime[Range[6000]],AllTrue[Rest[NestList[3#+2&,#,3]],PrimeQ]&] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Feb 25 2015 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..100000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(3*n+2) and IsPrime(9*n+8) and IsPrime(27*n+26)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
